ceterms:description: NBCOT certificants maintain their practice competency by satisfying a certification renewal requirement. The requirement includes a variety of competency assessment and professional development activities that certificants can utilize to sustain their occupational therapy practice skills. OTR, COTA, employers, and regulators provided input into identifying the activities and determining value of these activities.
ceterms:name: TESTING_Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant (COTA)速

ceterms:ownedBy.ceterms:description: Serving the public interest by advancing client care and professional practice through evidence-based certification standards and the validation of knowledge essential for effective practice in occupational therapy.
ceterms:ownedBy.ceterms:name: TESTING_National Board Certification in Occupational Therapy, Inc.

ceterms:assertedBy.ceterms:description: Serving the public interest by advancing client care and professional practice through evidence-based certification standards and the validation of knowledge essential for effective practice in occupational therapy.
ceterms:assertedBy.ceterms:name: TESTING_National Board Certification in Occupational Therapy, Inc.

ceterms:targetAssessment.ceterms:description:
The purpose of the NBCOT certification exam is to protect the public interest by certifying only those candidates who have the necessary knowledge of occupational therapy to practice.

The OCCUPATIONAL THERAPIST REGISTERED (OTR速) and CERTIFIED OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY ASSISTANT (COTA速) examinations are constructed to measure entry-level competence of candidates who have met eligibility requirements for certification of the respective credential.
- See more at: http://www.nbcot.org/about-the-exam#sthash.nwiNVtWo.dpuf
ceterms:targetAssessment.ceterms:name: TESTING_Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant
